comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Captain George Mackenzie Alexander's Attestation Paper of 20th September 1914 is on the Ancestry website. It shows he was born in Toronto on 1st May 1886. He was a bachelor and his next-of-kin was JM Alexander. At that time he worked in Wholesale Dry Goods but he had previously been in the 9th 48th Highlanders (3 yrs QDR).
It shows he was 6ft 1" with brown hair and brown eyes. A Presbyterian.
The 1891 census return shows him to be the son of James M (49) and Agnes M Alexander (36), both born in Scotland.

comment.author: 97985151@N06
comment._content: Congratulations on explore In Memory of Those We Have Lost 9/11

comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: His Attestation Papers can also be seen directly on the Canada Library and Archive website. Front sheet www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.02-e... Back sheet www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.02-e... Captain Alexander may well be amongst the officers of the 15th Battalion (48th Highlanders) who are shown at various stages of this film of the unit return to Canada in 1919. ptbowwi.blogspot.ca/2012/08/15thbattalion-48thHighlanders...
